I am a PhD student in ILCC, The University of Edinburgh, working on Natural Language Processing. I am supervised by Prof. Mirella Lapata. My main research interest is Relation Classification and Discourse Parsing.
Check out my Google Scholar, Weibo, or email me.

Publications:

  • Relation Classification Via Modeling Augmented Dependency Paths
    Yang Liu, Sujian Li, Furu Wei and Heng Ji. In IEEE/ACM Transactions on Audio, Speech, and Language Processing. (TASLP 2016).

  • Implicit Discourse Relation Classification via Multi-Task Neural Networks
    Yang Liu and Sujian Li. In Proceedings of AAAI 2016 Conference, 2016. (AAAI 2016).

  • A Dependency-Based Neural Network for Relation Classification
    Yang Liu, Furu Wei, Sujian Li, Heng Ji, and Ming Zhou. In Proceedings of the ACL-IJCNLP 2015 Conference, 2015. (ACL 2015). [Full-Version]

  • A Novel Neural Topic Model and Its Supervised Extension
    Cao Ziqiang, Li Sujian, Yang Liu, Li Wenjie and Ji Heng. In Proceedings of AAAI 2015 Conference, 2015. (AAAI 2015).

  • A Neural Network based Translation Constrained Reranking Model for Chinese Dependency Parsing
    Miaohong Chen, Baobao Chang and Yang Liu. In Proceedings of the Fourteenth China National Conference on Computational Linguistics, 2015. (CCL 2015).
